abstract_summ: Recent studies documented that SARS-Coronavirus2 (SARS-CoV2), responsible for COVID-19, can affect the nervous system . The aim of the present observational study was to prospectively assess subjective neurological symptoms (sNS) in patients . Sleep impairment was the most frequent symptom, followed by dysgeusia, headache, hyposmia, and depression . In a rare case of a patient diagnosed with COVID‐19 who manifested with concomitant neurological symptoms, the patient recovered .
